alert.note: Alert for Stafford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 6:07PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Stafford County through 645 PM CDT... At 606 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Neola. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Zenith and Neola around 606 PM CDT. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
